page.title: 17 CRANK WALKING DAY
page.content: Walking Day started when the village people walked round the edge of their village.Later it was used by the Church for the people to show their Christian faith. Walking Day takes place annually on a Saturday in July and the procession is accompanied by one or two brass bands. The children wear their best clothes and the girls usually carry baskets of flowers.Many village people walk down to King's Moss with the primary school children.Refreshments are served there, after which the infants are driven back to school on a decorated trailer.At school the children have tea and then change into games kit.There are races on the field,mainly for the children, but also for the adults.There are many stalls set up on the field and the race prize-money is quickly spent.Most people begin to leave at about 6:00pm.
